maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new favorite link in Internet Explorer.
Allows the user to create a new favorite link in Internet Explorer. Provides a switch to additionally create an entry in the Favorites Bar
Name to assign to the new Favorite link
URL to be added as favorite
Indicates that the favorite should be also added to the Favorites Bar
Name to assign to the new Favorite link
URL to be added as favorite
Indicates that the favorite should be also added to the Favorites Bar
None. You cannot pipe objects to Add-IEFavorite
None. Add-IEFavorite does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the link "www.fav-domain.com" as a Favorite Link under the name "MyFav"
Adds the link "www.fav-domain.com" as a Favorite Link under the name "MyFav". Additionally creates an entry in the Favorites Bar with the same name.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new proxy exception
Allows the user to add a proxy exception in Internet Explorer for a given domain
Domain to be added as an exception
Domain to be added as an exception
You can pipe domain names to the Add-IEProxyException Cmdlet.
None. Add-IEProxyException does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds "mydomain.com" as a proxy exception in Internet Explorer

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new NuGet source
Allows the user to add a new NuGet source with given name and path
Name of the new source
Path of the new source
Allows the insertion of duplicated entries
Name of the new source
Path of the new source
Allows the insertion of duplicated entries
You can pipe source name and source path to the Add-NuGetSource Cmdlet
None. Add-NuGetSource does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new NuGet source with name "mySource" and path "myPath"
Adds a new NuGet source with name "mySource" and path "myPath", if the name or path already exists its value is overriden.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new favorite in Windows Explorer.
Allows the user to create a new favorite link in Windows Explorer.
Name to assign to the new Favorite
Path to target to be added as favorite
Name to assign to the new Favorite
Path to target to be added as favorite
You can pipe the favorite name and path to the Add-WindowsExplorerFavorite Cmdlet
None. Add-NuGetSource does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new favorite with name 'newFav' pointing to target 'pathToTarget' in the Windows Explorer

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new shortcut
Allows the user to create a new shortcut in a given location, pointing to a desired target
Path to where place the shortcut. The shortcut name is taken from this paremeter.
Target of the shortcut.
Path to where place the shortcut. The shortcut name is taken from this paremeter.
Target of the shortcut.
You can pipe the shortcut filename or target to the Add-WindowsShortcut Cmdlet
None. Add-WindowsShortcut does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a shortcut placing it in pathToPlaceShortcut and pointing to targetOfTheShorcut

None. Clear-IEAllHistory does not generate any output.

None. Clear-IECookies does not generate any output.

Deletes all form data in Internet Explorer including saved passwords.

None. Show-RecycleBin does not generate any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the Recycle Bin

maml:description.maml:para: Starts Internet Explorer
Allows the user to start Internet Explorer
[url1,url2, ...] URLs to navigate to when opening

Width for the new Internet Explorer window
Indicates if Internet Explorer should open to a blank page

Width for the new Internet Explorer window
[url1,url2, ...] URLs to navigate to when opening

Width for the new Internet Explorer window
Indicates if Internet Explorer should open to a blank page

Indicates if the Magnifier should start minimized
None. You cannot pipe objects to Start-Magnifier
None. Start-Magnifier does not generate any output.

Name of the Solution File to open

None. You cannot pipe objects to Start-VS
None. Start-VS does not generate any output.

Allows the user to disable the Windows Automatic Updates
None. You cannot pipe objects to Suspend-WindowsUpdate
None. Suspend-WindowsUpdate does not generate any output.

maml:description.maml:para: Pings a host
Pings a single host or a list of hosts
XML file with a list of hosts to ping
XML file with a list of hosts to ping
You can pipe the hosts list to the Ping-Host Cmdlet
Warning message in case ping fails

dev:remarks.maml:para: Pings elements included in "hostsToPing"

maml:description.maml:para: Tests if the Screen Saver is enabled
Allows the user to test if the Screen Saver is enabled
None. You cannot pipe objects to Test-ScreenSaver
A string indicating if the Screen Saver is enabled or not

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests if the Screen Saver is enabled
"Screen Saver is enabled"

maml:description.maml:para: Pings a Url
Pings a single Url or a list of Urls
XML file with a list of urls to ping
Indicates if error messages should be outputted
XML file with a list of urls to ping
Indicates if error messages should be outputted
You can pipe the url list to the Test-Url Cmdlet
If the ShowSummary switch is present the Cmdlet with alert when pinging fails

dev:remarks.maml:para: Pings "myUrl". If an error occurs it will be outputted.

Allows the user to test if the Windows installation is genuine
None. You cannot pipe objects to Test-WindowsOriginal
A string indicating if the Windows installation is genuine or not
